author: George Orwell
description: A novel about a dystopian future where society is under constant surveillance by an authoritarian regime.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and the destruction of innocence, set in a small Southern town.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American Dream and the roaring 1920s, centered around the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel of manners, following the romantic entanglements of the Bennet sisters.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy a powerful ring that threatens the world.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing the world of wizards and the young wizard Harry Potter.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about a teenager's disillusionment with the adult world, narrated by the iconic character Holden Caulfield.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A series of seven fantasy novels set in the magical land of Narnia.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of state control over new and powerful technologies.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prelude to 'The Lord of the Rings', this novel follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who finds a powerful ring.
